subarray

public static boolean[] subarray(boolean[] array,
                                 int fromIndex,
                                 int length)
Building on the arraycopy function in System, this function returns a "subarray" of a larger array. The length parameter determines the length of the resulting array. Standard out of bounds exceptions on length can be expected.

Parameters:
array -
fromIndex - first element in returned array
length - amount to read from array
Returns:
boolean array consisting of elements in range [fromIndex,fromIndex+length]
See Also:
booleanUtil#subarray(boolean[], int)}

subarray

public static boolean[] subarray(boolean[] array,
                                 int fromIndex)
Building on the arraycopy function in System, this function returns a "subarray" of a larger array. Function returns subarray starting at fromIndex and ending with the final element of the array. * @see booleanUtil#subarray(boolean[], int, int)

Parameters:
array -
fromIndex -
Returns:
